It provides the syntax for creating WHILE (eg, WHILE a gap measurement < 1,5) or FOR NEXT (eg, FOR NEXT 5 times) loops, whichever applies to the situation. The element <dmLoop> contains an expression that is the WHILE condition for the loop and the element <dmSeq> (the content of the loop). The user will traverse the data module sequence as long as the expression evaluates to TRUE. The author is responsible for providing a way to update the variable or global property used in the WHILE condition so that the “truth” of the condition can change and the user can exit the loop. Optionally a loop can contain a loop entrance assertion (described by the element <variablePreSet>) and a loop end assertion (described by the element <assertion>) enabling counters to be implemented. The loop entrance assertion is made when (and only when) the user first enters the loop (eg, [Counter = 0]). The loop end assertion (eg, [Counter = Counter + 1]) is made each time the user reaches the end of the loop sequence described by the element <dmSeq>. The loop condition might be [Counter <= 5].

element.name: dmlRef
element.definition: The element <dmlRef> contains any references to other data management lists (eg, for partial data management requirement list).

element.name: dmlRefGroup
element.definition: The element <dmlRefGroup> contains one or several references to data management lists to which the comment relates.

element.name: dmlRefIdent
element.definition: to be found in DML schema

element.name: dmlStatus
element.definition: The element <dmlStatus> contains information about the status of the list.

element.name: dmNode
element.definition:
A data module node represents technical information that is to be displayed on one screen. This screen can be scrollable.
In a process data module, technical content is "wrapped" in the element <dmNode> structure allowing applicability (refer to Para ) and variable settings, using element <variablePreSet> (refer to Para ) and <variablePostSet> (refer to Para ), to be applied to the content. The element <title> provides a descriptive heading, which applies to the whole node.
It is important to remember that the element <dmNode> represents one screen of data, and if a dialog or message appears on the screen, it must appear after a procedural step or by itself. Reasons for this are (1) dialogs can alter the state information possibly changing the applicability of something after the dialog on the screen, and (2) dialogs have navigation choices which would allow the user to exit the screen before reading everything on it.

element.name: dmNodeAlts
element.definition:
An alternative (or conditional) node is a group of objects, one or none of which will be applicable and thus displayed in a given situation.
The following discussion of the element <dmNodeAlts> applies to any other alternates group such as:
The alternates group concept is detailed in Chap 4.13.3.
The element <dmNodeAlts> (a group of node alternatives) provides the ability to group occurrences of the element <dmNode> together which apply in different contextual situations. Only one node or none of the group will be displayed. For example, three versions of a "disconnect connector" step can exist in the element <dmNodeAlts> due to equipment configuration differences. For any configuration, only one version of the step applies. The logic engine will evaluate the applicability expression for all occurrences of the element <dmNode> within the element <dmNodeAlts>. Only the first node whose applicability expression evaluates to TRUE will be displayed. There need not be an occurrence of the element <dmNode> within the element <dmNodeAlts> that is applicable to every possible situation. In such cases, the logic engine simply moves on to the next element <dmNode>. Every node in an alternative node must have applicability. Applicability on the alternative elements is optional in the content section of the Schema with the exception of the element <dmSeqAlts> within the element <dmIf>. For alternative processing, however, applicability is required on the alternative elements.
Applicability on the nodes of an alternates group must be mutually exclusive. Although the Schema does not require the alternative element <dmNode> to have mutually exclusive applicability (or the attribute applicRefId at all), it is important to understand the danger of overlapping applicability on alternative nodes. At most one will pass thru the logic engine to be displayed to the user, and if more than one applies, the user will miss something. A node with no applicability always applies. There can be reasons to author overlapping applicability within an alternates group, but it is not recommended.

element.name: dmodule
element.definition: The common main container element for every data module.

element.name: dmRef
element.definition: The element <dmRef> contains the necessary information items to build a link to a destination data module. It contains the identification of the destination data module as well as information to control presentation and behavior of the reference/link to the data module or a fragment of the data module.

element.name: dmRefAddressItems
element.definition:
The element <dmRefAddressItems> contains additional identifying information about the destination data module.
The project or the organization must be aware of the implications of using the title and the issue date of the destination data module when referenced data modules are updated.

element.name: dmRefGroup
element.definition: The element <dmRefGroup> contains one or several references to data modules to which the comment relates.

element.name: dmRefIdent
element.definition:
The element <dmRefIdent> contains the items forming a unique identification of the destination data module.
The project or the organization must be aware of the implications of using issue and inwork numbers as well as language and country codes of the destination data module when referenced data modules are updated.

element.name: dmSegmentRef
element.definition: The element <dmSegmentRef> contains all necessary details to constitute a reference from some context, such as a data module or a publication module, to portions of a destination data module by the use of an XPath expression.

element.name: dmSeq
element.definition: A data module sequence determines the order of steps, dialogs, external application calls, data module references, and/or conditional actions within the data module.

element.name: dmSeqAlts
element.definition: An alternative (or conditional) sequence is a group of sequence orders where one or none will be applicable and thus executed in a given situation. The element <dmSeqAlts> contains one or more order of data module sequences. Each child element <dmSeq> has an attribute applicRefId referring to a pre-defined element <applic>. Refer to Para and Chap 4.13.3 for more information about the alternates group concept.

element.name: dmStatus
element.definition: The element <dmStatus> contains information about the status of the data module.

element.name: dmThenSeq
element.definition:
The element <dmThenSeq> and the element <dmElseSeq> are identical and contain data module nodes, alternative sequences, branches, or loops to be traversed depending on the evaluation of the element <dmIf> expression.
Markup elements: <dmThenSeq> and <dmElseSeq>

element.name: dmTitle
element.definition: The element <dmTitle> contains the title of the data module. The data module title must give meaning to the Product identification and action elements of the data module code. Refer to Chap 3.9.5.2.1.5.

element.name: documentIncorporation
element.definition: The element <documentIncorporation> lists the data modules and publications that this technical condition affects.

element.name: effectivity
element.definition: The element <effectivity> identifies the range of products on which the item is fitted in this location.

element.name: electricalEquip
element.definition: The element <electricalEquip> is contained within the list of electrical equipment element <electricalEquipGroup>. It contains electrical equipment information of the Product's wiring.

element.name: electricalEquipAlts
element.definition: The element <electricalEquipAlts>, within the list of electrical equipment element <electricalEquipGroup>, provides the capability to group several alternate solutions of electrical equipment data for different applicability annotations. Refer to Chap 4.13.3 for information related to the use of the alternates group mechanism in data module content.

element.name: electricalEquipConnection
element.definition: The element <electricalEquipConnection> gives information about the electrical connections that belong to a transverse link.

element.name: electricalEquipGroup
element.definition: the list of electrical equipment

element.name: electricalEquipState
element.definition: The electrical equipment state element <electricalEquipState> provides state information for each connection to some particular electrical equipment.

element.name: electricalLogic
element.definition: The element <electricalLogic> provides an optional container for electrical states and internal connections between contacts for electrical or electronic equipment.

element.name: electricalPotential
element.definition:
The element <electricalPotential> is used to order the wires based on project or organization specific rules, using the relation to termination module, block and shunt, or pole and position, and the contact identification.
There are two different cases for coding of the electrical potential information:
Equipment without internal logic. Equipment, such as connectors, earth bolts, etc, do not have an internal logic. The ascending values in element <contactOrderValue> represent the order of the equipment contacts to facilitate graphical presentation and connection analysis. Contacts of the equipment to which no physical wire is connected are included by wires with the wire state value "notactiv". For equipment without internal logic, the elements <terminationModuleGroupingValue>, <blockGroupingValue> and <shuntGroupingValue> must not be used.
Equipment with internal logic. Equipment, such as switches, relays and terminal junction modules have an internal logic. That means, the equipment has internal connections, which connect different contacts of the equipment electrically. For switches and relays, these electrical connections depend on the switch/relay position. The internal electrical connections are the basis for the coding of the elements <terminationModuleGroupingValue>, <blockGroupingValue> and <shuntGroupingValue>. Examples for the population of these elements are given in Para .

element.name: electricalStateDescr
element.definition: The electrical state description element <electricalStateDescr> contains the narrative description of an electrical state, for example "ENERGIZED".

element.name: elseIf
element.definition: The element <elseIf> contains an "if" statement to be used if another "if" condition is not met.

element.name: email
element.definition: The element <email> contains contact email addresses for the business.

element.name: embeddedSpareDescr
element.definition:
The element <embeddedSpareDescr> contains the information of each spare item when included in a spare material set or the information of the original spare when included in a modified spare <spareDescr>.
The hierarchical relation between <spareDescr> and <embeddedSpareDescr> is:

element.name: embeddedSupplyDescr
element.definition:
The element <embeddedSupplyDescr> contains the information of each item included in a supply set.
The hierarchical relation between the element <supplyDescr> and the element <embeddedSupplyDescr> is the following:

element.name: embeddedSupportEquipDescr
element.definition:
The element <embeddedSupportEquipDescr> contains the information of each item included in a set of support equipment. In this case, the attribute materialUsage is set to "mu05" in the element <supportEquipDescr>.
The hierarchical relation between the element <supportEquipDescr> and the element <embeddedSupportEquipDescr> is the following:

element.name: emcCode
element.definition: The electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) code element <emcCode> identifies the EMC classification of a wire or a harness.

element.name: emphasis
element.definition:
The element <emphasis> contains textual information (eg, a word, an expression or a sentence) to be highlighted.
To highlight a word, an expression or a sentence, bold text is the preferred method. Alternatively, the use of color is permitted. Capital (uppercase) letters, italics or underlining are not permitted to highlight text, except for legacy data. Refer to Chap 3.9.1.

element.name: enabledState
element.definition:
The element <enabledState> contains an expression that evaluates state variables to determine if data entry field input is permitted or inhibited (usually the data entry is visible, but dimmed or grayed out).
The element <enabledState> is evaluated when data input is entered within the dialog and before the dialog is submitted. Typically, this is used when a user selects a menu choice that requires additional data entry information, while other menu choices do not require the additional data entry.
An example is a dialog containing both a menu and a user entry dialog. The menu has two choices: integer (assertion is [datatype = "integer"]) and real (assertion is [datatype = "real"]). The user entry dialog requests a real precision value (enable expression is [datatype equal "real"]). If the integer choice is selected from the menu, the user entry is disabled. If the real choice is selected, the user entry is enabled.

element.name: endItemCode
element.definition: The element <endItemCode> contains the end item code which typically consists of a three-character alphanumeric code. The end item code is another type of identifier, similar to NSN, CAGE Code, part number, etc.

element.name: endMatter
element.definition: The element <endMatter> contains end matter using the element <para>.

element.name: enterprise
element.definition: The element <enterprise> contains the name of the enterprise, and when applicable, the body within an enterprise, from where the comment/response is sent.

element.name: enterpriseGroup
element.definition: The element <enterpriseGroup> contains the supply product list of manufacturers, suppliers, etc.

element.name: enterpriseIdent
element.definition: The element <enterpriseIdent> identifies an enterprise, thru its CAGE code.

element.name: enterpriseIdentAlt
element.definition: The element <enterpriseIdentAlt> provides an alternate method of identifying an enterprise where the enterprise does not have a CAGE code.

element.name: enterpriseInfo
element.definition: The element <enterpriseInfo> contains information about a supplier of the supply.

element.name: enterpriseLogo
element.definition:
The element <enterpriseLogo> contains logotypes of the manufacturer of the Product.
The first appearance of the element <symbol> will by default be the one presented on the title page. Refer to Chap 6.2.3.1.
The content is authored or derived from the source publication module.

element.name: enterpriseName
element.definition: The element <enterpriseName> contains a text string identifying the enterprise.

element.name: enterpriseRef
element.definition: The element <enterpriseRef> contains data about an enterprise and also allows referring to its position in the enterprise CIR. In the context of the part data, the element <enterpriseRef> can be used to indicate the authorized prime source supplier for the part or to specify additional suppliers.

element.name: enterpriseRepository
element.definition: The element <enterpriseRepository> contains a list of enterprise descriptions.

element.name: enterpriseSpec
element.definition: The element <enterpriseSpec> contains information about the manufacturer of the product such as the enterprise name, the business unit and address.

element.name: enterpriseUnit
element.definition: the business unit of the division, given as a simple text string

element.name: entityControlNumber
element.definition: The element <entityControlNumber> must contain only the CONTROLNUMBER without TYPE and FORMAT (ie, without any prefix or postfix) separated by hyphens as appropriate.

element.name: entry
element.definition: The element <entry> (table entry) represents a table cell.

element.name: enumeration
element.definition:
The element <enumeration> provides the allowable values for the product attribute. The allowable values can be used to assist the technical author in creating applicability annotations.
The element <enumeration> is optional and repeatable. If there are multiple values and ranges to define, several methods can be employed, including the following:
- single element <enumeration> with attribute applicPropertyValues representing the entire set of values and ranges
- multiple element <enumeration> with attribute applicPropertyValues representing a single value or range

element.name: equip
element.definition: The element <equip> contains the identification of an individual piece of equipment associated with the task.

element.name: equipDescrRef
element.definition: The element <equipDescrRef> contains references to other parts of the electrical system publications, which give further information about this electrical equipment, such as the description of how it is made.

element.name: equipGroup
element.definition: The element <equipGroup> contains the grouping of the equipment that used in or associated with the task.

element.name: equipmentNotAvailable
element.definition: The element <equipmentNotAvailable> contains the condition of the equipment (shortages, malfunctions, etc) that makes equipment not ready or not available for use. This element is aligned with the checklist item or paragraph for which the equipment not ready/available is applicable. This element includes a required element <para>.

element.name: equipName
element.definition: The element <equipName> describes the electrical equipment. A standard name, like SWITCH, can be used or a name that defines the electrical equipment in conjunction with its use on the system, for example BATTERY MASTER SWITCH.

element.name: estimatedTime
element.definition: The element <estimatedTime> contains the estimate of aggregation of all the time that the person will be required to complete the task. The estimated time must be given in man-hours with maximum one decimal (eg, 2,4 h). The time and unit of measure must be entered.

element.name: evaluate
element.definition:
The element <evaluate> is used to group tests together and provide the logical operation to apply to the test results. The element <evaluate> must be used whenever more than one test, element <assert>, is required. The element <evaluate> can contain other instances of the element <evaluate> and is therefore recursive. This allows for very complicated applicability annotations to be represented with a simple structure consisting of only two element types.
To process the element <evaluate> all child elements are evaluated, each providing a Boolean value of "true" or "false". Then the logical "and" or "or" operation is performed on the results, providing a single Boolean result. A result of the value "true" means the associated content is valid and a result of the value "false" means the associated content is not valid. The method of presenting validity is a project or an organization decision. Some projects or organizations will remove invalid content while others will want to de-emphasize the invalid content in some way.

element.name: example
element.definition: The element <example> provides markup and/or narrative examples illustrating the effect of the business rule decisions with a corresponding definition.

element.name: excludedModification
element.definition: The element <excludedModification> contains an indication that the modification is not covered even though it was actually required.

element.name: exportControl
element.definition: The element <exportControl> is used to define any government regulations concerning access to the data module.

element.name: exportRegistrationCode
element.definition: The element <exportRegistrationCode> is used to indicate a coded value representing an export control property that applies to the content of the data module.

element.name: exportRegistrationStmt
element.definition: The element <exportRegistrationStmt> is used to specify either a full or a partial export registration statement describing the export status of the data module content.

element.name: expression
element.definition:
Expressions are combinations of variables or global properties and operators. The logic engine evaluates expressions primarily in order to determine what is displayed to the user as in applicability ([Model = "T"]) and branching ([If Error Condition = "4"]) and loop (WHILE [Counter < "5"]) conditions. Expressions are also used to assign a value to a variable or global property ([Ave = Sum / 3]). Refer to Chap 7.6.1.4 for detailed information.
The element <expression> defines something to be evaluated by the logic engine. Expressions are used to assign values to variables in assertions, eg, the value of the expression [Counter plus 1] might be assigned to the variable Counter. They are also used in applicability, branches, and other constructs to determine what is displayed to the user. In element <applic>, for example, if the expression [Item deployed equal TRUE] evaluates to TRUE, the data item containing the applicability is displayed and vice versa. Expressions are authored by combining variables (or other expressions) and values with binary or unary operators. In their simplest form, an expression can be just a variable/global property or a value. The element <assert> can also be used to simplify the authoring of complicated expressions.

element.name: externalApplication
element.definition: The element <externalApplication> is a mechanism for launching an external application in the midst of a process data module. This application might be a wiring data viewer, a calculator, a diagnostic test, etc. Refer to Chap 3.9.5.2.10.3 for expanded coverage of the element <externalApplication>.

element.name: externalAssert
element.definition: The element <externalAssert> is based on the element <assert>. Refer to Chap 3.9.5.3. An external assertion identifyies a product attribute, a product attribute value or a condition defined in an ACT data module using the element <applicCrossRefTableRef>.

element.name: externalCond
element.definition: The element <externalCond> specifies a condition defined in another CCT. This element must be used only by projects or organizations implementing the ACT catalog. Refer to Chap 4.14.4. In this case, the ACT catalog must provide the reference to the condition definition.

element.name: externalProductAttribute
element.definition: The element <externalProductAttribute> specifies a product attribute defined in another ACT. This element must be used only by projects or organizations implementing the ACT catalog. Refer to Chap 4.14.4. In this case, the ACT catalog must provide the reference to the product attribute definition.

element.name: externalPubCode
element.definition: The element <externalPubCode> contains, as textual content, a code that identifies a publication or document by a non-S1000D identity, such as an ISBN code or similar.

element.name: externalPubIssue
element.definition: The element <externalPubIssue> contains, as text content, issue identification of a non-S1000D publication or document.

element.name: externalPubIssueDate
element.definition:
The element <externalPubIssueDate> contains date information about the referenced publication.
If the <externalPubIssueDate> contains a date in textual form, then that text will be displayed to the user. If only the attributes are provided, then it must be displayed in the ISO 8601 calendar date format YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD. If the attribute month of <externalPubIssueDate> is populated then the attribute year must also be populated. If the attribute day is populated then the attribute month must also be populated. Refer to default BREX rule BREX-S1-00061.

element.name: externalPubIssueInfo
element.definition: The element <externalPubIssueInfo> contains issue information concerning the referred non-S1000D publication or document.

element.name: externalPubRef
element.definition: The element <externalPubRef> contains the identification of a referenced non-S10000D publication or document.

element.name: externalPubRefAddressItems
element.definition: The element <externalPubRefAddressItems> contains, as textual content, additional information potentially useful to identify the non-S1000D destination publication or document.

element.name: externalPubRefIdent
element.definition: The element <externalPubRefIdent> contains the identification of a non-S1000D publication or document.

element.name: externalPubTitle
element.definition: The element <externalPubTitle> contains, as textual content, the title of a non-S1000D publication or document.

element.name: externalSco
element.definition: The element <externalSco> is used within a SCO content data module to establish data links to existing SCO that are not managed in accordance with S1000D. The linking mechanism is the same as that used to refer from a data module to any non-S10000D publication or document.

element.name: externalScoIssue
element.definition: to be found in complex Elements schema

element.name: externalScoIssueInfo
element.definition: to be found in complex Elements schema

element.name: extraResources
element.definition: The element <extraResources> is used to refer to figures, tables and multimedia objects required by the training step.

element.name: falseValue
element.definition: The element <falseValue> is an expression operand that is set to "false" with the data type Boolean.

element.name: fastener
element.definition: The element <fastener> is used to store access point fastener information.

element.name: fastenerQuantity
element.definition: The element <fastenerQuantity> contains the quantity of fasteners.

element.name: fastenerType
element.definition: The element <fastenerType> contains the type of the fastener.

element.name: fault
element.definition: the basic fault presented through the attribute faultCode

element.name: faultCond
element.definition: the potential fault condition

element.name: faultContext
element.definition: the textual description of the context in which the fault is observed

element.name: faultDescr
element.definition: The element <faultDescr> contains the description of the isolated fault.

element.name: faultEquip
element.definition: the equipment involved in the malfunction

element.name: faultIsolation
element.definition: The fault isolation branch of the Schema identifies and describes the fault and gives the diagnostic path to isolate a faulty item.

element.name: faultIsolationProcedure
element.definition: The element <faultIsolationProcedure> contains the detailed fault isolation procedure including fault code, fault description, and the possible causes of the malfunction that can be isolated through the fault isolation procedure.

element.name: faultIsolationRef
element.definition: the reference to information needed to isolate the detected/observed fault

element.name: faultIsolationTest
element.definition: The element <faultIsolationTest> contains the test description, test parameters and the test procedure.

element.name: faultMessageBody
element.definition: the main part of the fault message

element.name: faultMessageIndication
element.definition: the indication part of the fault message (eg, "temperature")

element.name: faultReporting
element.definition: The element <faultReporting> contains information to enable technician or computerized maintenance systems to indicate faults through data modules.

element.name: faultySubSystem
element.definition: the faulty subsystem

element.name: faxNumber
element.definition: The element <faxNumber> contains contact fax numbers for the business.

element.name: feedThru
element.definition: If a wire passes thru equipment (eg, a current transformer), this is identified by using the feed-thru element <feedThru>.

element.name: fieldName
element.definition: The element <fieldName> contains the name of the data field (ie, the project or the organization specific naming of electrical data).

element.name: figure
element.definition:
This element contains the figure. The figure consists of a title and one or more illustrations sheets, using the element <graphic>, and a figure title. It can also contain a legend.
For specific rules and guidance for the preparation of illustrations, refer to Chap 3.9.2.
In all cases, figures must be placed as near as possible to, and preferably immediately following, the related text.

element.name: figureAlts
element.definition: The element <figureAlts> is an alternate group that provides the capability to group several alternatives to a figure.

element.name: figureAltsIdent
element.definition: The element <figureAltsIdent> identifies a figure alternates group.

element.name: figureIdent
element.definition: The element <figureIdent> identifies a figure.

element.name: finishingInfo
element.definition: The element <finishingInfo> contains the finishing information for the connection of wires to a contact.

element.name: firstName
element.definition: The element <firstName> contains the first or given name of the individual contact.

element.name: firstVerification
element.definition: The element <firstVerification> identifies a data module which has been first verified.

element.name: fitmentCode
element.definition: The element <fitmentCode> indicates whether an item can be fitted as supplied.

element.name: foldout
element.definition: The element <foldout> is used to contain a figure, or table which is larger than the default size.

element.name: footnote
element.definition:
The element <footnote> contains bibliographic references or explanations which would take too much space or in any other way would be annoying for the reader in the running text.
The element <footnote> is a wrapper around the contents of a footnote. The element <footnote> typically generates a marker (eg, a superscripted number) at the place in the flow of text where it occurs. The footnote itself is then generally presented at the bottom of the page or at the end of the table.
Footnotes are used in tables (table footnotes) or in regular text and titles (inline footnotes).
Footnotes must not
− be used for references and cross-references
− include footnotes

element.name: footnoteRef
element.definition: The element <footnoteRef> contains the link information to a previously defined footnote. This link information is used each time when referring to the same footnote.

element.name: footnoteRemarks
element.definition: The element <footnoteRemarks> contains either textual content of remarks using the element <simplePara> or internal reference to footnotes using the element<footnoteRef>. It allows internal references to a target element<footnote>.

element.name: frequency
element.definition: The element <frequency> contains the frequency of wire material in relation to the attenuation.

element.name: frequencyAttenuation
element.definition: The element <frequencyAttenuation> contains the frequency and attenuation information of wire material.

element.name: frequencyCharacteristics
element.definition: The element <frequencyCharacteristics> contains alternating current frequency characteristics of wire material.

element.name: fromEquip
element.definition: The content model electrical equipment defines the child elements of the elements <fromEquip> and <toEquip>, which contain the wire connection information for the two wire ends.

element.name: frontMatter
element.definition:
The Front matter Schema contains three branches supporting the following Front matter types:
− Title page.
− Table of contents.
− Highlights and various Front matter lists.

element.name: frontMatterDmEntry
element.definition: The element <frontMatterDmEntry> contains the data module entry. The order of the front matter data module entries must follow structure of the publication (= TOC).

element.name: frontMatterExternalPubEntry
element.definition: The element <frontMatterExternalPubEntry> contains the non-S1000D publication (external publication) entry.

element.name: frontMatterInfo
element.definition:
The element <frontMatterInfo> contains miscellaneous Front matter information (eg, manufacturer's information, error reporting, availability statements or general purpose notices including an introductory title). Several sets of Front matter information and types can be given.
The titles must be coded with attribute emphasisType value em01.

element.name: frontMatterList
element.definition:
The element <frontMatterList> contains the information for the:
− List of effective pages - LOEP
− List of effective data modules - LOEDM
− Highlights - HIGH
The Schema also supports the capturing and representation of publication lists for the List of applicable publications.

element.name: frontMatterPmEntry
element.definition: The element <frontMatterPmEntry> contains the publication module entry.

element.name: frontMatterSubList
element.definition:
The element <frontMatterSubList> contains the information for the:
− List of effective pages - LOEP.
− List of effective data modules - LOEDM.
− Highlights - HIGH (without and with updating instructions)
The entries can be grouped in one or more front matter lists (<frontMatterSubList>) each having a title (<title>) and one or more introductory paragraphs (<reducedPara>).

element.name: frontMatterTableOfContent
element.definition:
The element <frontMatterTableOfContent> contains the Table of contents information. Two types of Table of contents are possible:
− A non-hierarchical (flat) structure.
− A hierarchical structure.
Both types list the data modules and any publications or external publications in the order given by the source publication module.

element.name: frontMatterTitlePage
element.definition:
The element <frontMatterTitlePage> contains the title page information.
Rules for presentation of title pages in accordance with the S1000D standard page-oriented presentation is given in Chap 6.2.3.1.

element.name: fullNatoStockNumber
element.definition: The element <fullNatoStockNumber> contains the NATO stock number (NSN) ready for presentation.

element.name: functionalDescrRef
element.definition: The element <functionalDescrRef> contains references to other parts of the electrical system publications for further information about a wire, harness or electrical equipment (eg, a description of how it is made and its function).

element.name: functionalItem
element.definition:
The element <functionalItem> contains information that describes the functional item and provides further information related to the functional item based on the Product configuration.
Configuration consistency between the various alternate functional items must be ensured. This means that, for a given Product configuration and under given operational conditions, only one alternate functional item is applicable at one time for a given functional item.

element.name: functionalItemAlts
element.definition: The element <functionalItemAlts> is a group of functional item alternates.

element.name: functionalItemCode
element.definition: The element <functionalItemCode> contains a code that represents the functional breakdown.

element.name: functionalItemFamily
element.definition: The element <functionalItemFamily> contains the family equipment the functional item belongs to, for example a technological category that characterizes it.

element.name: functionalItemIdent
element.definition:
The element <functionalItemIdent>, contrary to the attribute id, semantically identifies the functional item as a result of its attributes.
A functional item can be used to uniquely identify an item performing a function in a given system at a given position for a given Product.
For example a functional item can be the third pump in a hydraulic system for a given Product. Depending on the Product instance, this functional item can be mechanical or electrical and, so, can perform the function of a hydraulic pump.
The functional item is also known as the reference designator.
The codification of functional item identifier is up to the project or the organization.

element.name: functionalItemRef
element.definition:
The element <functionalItemRef> contains a reference to the functional item’s CIR data module.
A functional item can be used to uniquely identify an item that performs a function, in a system that is part of a Product.
For example a functional item can be the third pump in a hydraulic system of a Product. Depending on the Product instance, this functional item can be mechanical or electrical, and so, can perform the function of a hydraulic pump.
The functional item is also known as the reference designator.

element.name: functionalItemRefGroup
element.definition:
The element <functionalItemRefGroup> provides relationships and the types of relationships with other functional items (eg, sub-functional items or software functional items related to a hardware functional item).
Depending on the relationships, it can depend on the product instances or not. As a result, this element can be found at both container and alternate levels.

element.name: functionalItemRepository
element.definition: The element <functionalItemRepository> provides a list of functional items and their associated properties.

element.name: functionalItemSpec
element.definition:
The element <functionalItemSpec> contains the associated properties of one functional item.
Some properties of the functional item can vary from one product instance to another. Such properties are managed under the functional item alternates (element <functionalItemAlts>), which can contain a reference to an applicability annotation.
For some properties appearing at both levels (eg, <name> or <shortName>), the following rule must be applied: if the property is fulfilled in the alternate element, it supersedes the generic value stored in the parent element.

element.name: functionalPhysicalAreaIdent
element.definition:
The element <functionalPhysicalAreaIdent> semantically identifies the functional and/or physical area as a result of its attributes.
If values "0", "00" or "0000" are filled in the optional attributes subSystemCode, subSubSystemCode and assyCode, they are considered as significant values. In addition to the functional and/or physical area identifier, the system difference code can be specified for each functional and/or physical area.

element.name: functionalPhysicalAreaRef
element.definition: The element <functionalPhysicalAreaRef> is used to mark up a functional and/or physical area (outside of its specification in the functional and/or physical areas CIR) and also allows referring to its specification in the functional and/or physical areas CIR.

element.name: functionalPhysicalAreaRefGroup
element.definition:
The element <functionalPhysicalAreaRefGroup> reflects the functional and/or physical breakdown. If used, it must only contain the links from a functional and/or physical area to its direct child elements.
This means that a system can only refer to subsystems with the same system code values, a subsystem can only refer to sub-subsystems with the same system and subsystem code values, etc.

element.name: functionalPhysicalAreaRepository
element.definition: The element <functionalPhysicalAreaRepository> contains a list of functional and/or physical areas and their associated properties.

element.name: functionalPhysicalAreaSpec
element.definition:
The element <functionalPhysicalAreaSpec> contains the associated properties of one functional and/or physical area.
There are six types of functional and/or physical areas: the systems, the subsystems, the sub-subsystems, the assemblies, the disassemblies and the disassembly variants.
A given functional and/or physical area can have applicability and may not be valid for all instances of a Product.

element.name: genericPartData
element.definition: The element <genericPartData> contains one project or organization specific part data item not covered by any of the other data elements in the IPD Schema.

element.name: genericPartDataGroup
element.definition:
The element <genericPartDataGroup> contains any project or organization specific data.
The current IPD structure strongly relies on the S2000M data organization. For non-S2000M projects, some specific data cannot be covered by the existing S2000M data elements. For that purpose, the element <genericPartDataGroup> allows the definition and storage of any kind of non-S2000M data within the IPD content.
The IPD team must nevertheless first analyze the correspondence between the source data and the S2000M data elements which are already addressable by the current IPD Schema. If there is compliance, the existing S2000M data must be used. Otherwise the new data is populated in the element <genericPartDataGroup> with its name and value.

element.name: genericPartDataValue
element.definition: The element <genericPartDataValue> contains the non-S2000M data value.

element.name: genericProperty
element.definition: The element <genericProperty> contains a single property associated to the product.

element.name: genericPropertyGroup
element.definition: The element <genericPropertyGroup> contains list of properties associated to the product or part of the product that are interesting to provide to the end user.

element.name: globalPropertyRef
element.definition: The element <globalPropertyRef> points to a global property.

element.name: graphic
element.definition: The element contains the external entity reference to the illustration file.

element.name: groundingType
element.definition: The element <groundingType> is used for electrical functional items (grounding points). It indicates the grounding type or bonding segregation, which is necessary to perform the appropriate ground tests after installation. The grounding type is specified according to the current type, the voltage and the system essentiality (eg, current return for 230V DC power supply in non-essential system 2). The bonding segregation is specified according to signal type and system essentiality (eg, bonding point for wire linked to essential system 1).

element.name: groupCode
element.definition: The element <groupCode> indicates the physical grouping of wires connected to the same contact. For example, where multiple wires are connected to a terminal stud using multiple ring terminals, each wire connected to the same ring terminal must have the same group code (eg, A). Wires that are connected to the same terminal stud but to another ring terminal must have another group code (eg, B). This means that an identical group code indicates wires, which are physically connected to the same ring terminal.

element.name: groupNumber
element.definition: The element <groupNumber> contains a number or other identifier associated with major components, assemblies, and subassemblies that form functional groups. Subordinate, sub-functional groups or sub-subassemblies relate to the base group number (top position) in a sequential, next higher assembly (NHA) relationship (ie, top-down breakdown structure). The functional group applies to repairable assemblies and subassemblies, for example, spares (any repairable component required for the maintenance or repair of an end item), but not to repair parts (any consumable, non-repairable component required for the maintenance or repair of an end item).

element.name: harness
element.definition: The element <harness> is contained within the element <harnessGroup> to provide a list of harnesses. It contains harness information of the Product's wiring. The electrical wires of a system are often divided into separate harnesses.

element.name: harnessAlts
element.definition: The element <harnessAlts>, within the list of harnesses element <harnessGroup>, provides the capability to group several alternate solutions of harness data for different applicability annotations.

element.name: harnessEnvironment
element.definition: The element <harnessEnvironment> contains information concerning the environment in which a harness is located.

element.name: harnessGroup
element.definition: the list of harnesses

element.name: harnessIdent
element.definition: The element <harnessIdent> contains the unique identifier of a harness in the system. It is the link between the harness and the included wires.

element.name: harnessInfo
element.definition:
The element <harnessInfo> contains harness information for the detailed identification of a harness (eg, the part number and alternative identifications that can be used to identify this harness).
If the element <harnessInfo> is used, then it is recommended that at least the child element <partNumber> is populated for detailed identification of the harness.

element.name: harnessName
element.definition: The element <harnessName> contains the name of a harness.

element.name: harnessSize
element.definition: The element <harnessSize> describes the minimum and the maximum size of the harness, to which a shrink sleeve can be applied.

element.name: harnessVariantIdent
element.definition: The element <harnessVariantIdent> contains the variant of a harness. Improvements during series production or engineering requirements are reasons why different harnesses are used in one type of system. This element identifies the different harnesses. A harness variant can be part of the project or the organization specific part number.

element.name: harnessVariantIssue
element.definition: The element <harnessVariantIssue> contains the issue of a harness variant.

element.name: hazardousClass
element.definition: The element <hazardousClass> identifies hazardous parts. In addition, the class of hazard can be specified by the attribute hazardousClassValue.

element.name: helpInfo
element.definition: The element <helpInfo> provides additional textual information relative to the dialog.

element.name: hotspot
element.definition: The element <hotspot> contains the definition of graphical regions in an illustration. It also contains information needed to navigate between graphical objects or between graphical objects and text.

element.name: hoursToClose
element.definition: The element <hoursToClose> contains the elapsed time necessary to close the access point, in hours.

element.name: hoursToOpen
element.definition: The element <hoursToOpen> contains the elapsed time necessary to open the access point, in hours.

element.name: icnContents
element.definition: The element <icnContents> contains metadata related to the ICN object to enable it to be invoked and presented in a specific context (eg, in a data module).

element.name: icnInfoItem
element.definition: The element <icnInfoItem> contains one metadata item associated to the ICN.

element.name: icnInfoItemGroup
element.definition: The element <icnInfoItemGroup> contains the various types of metadata items that are useful to identify and manage the ICN.

element.name: icnKeyword
element.definition: The element <icnKeyword> contains a single keyword that classifies the ICN object in various respects and can be used to find the object when it is stored in a repository of ICN objects.

element.name: icnKeywordGroup
element.definition: The element <icnKeywordGroup> contains one or several keywords that classify the ICN object in various respects. The keywords can be used for characterizing the ICN object in order to facilitate efficient searching for it in a CSDB.

element.name: icnObject
element.definition: The element <icnObject> contains the description of one identifiable object in multimedia or graphics information. This description can be recursive, specifying that one object is hierarchically related to other objects.

element.name: icnObjectGroup
element.definition: The element <icnObjectGroup> identifies the objects in the multimedia or graphics information as needed to achieve an intended interaction between the ICN file content and the XML in which it is invoked.

element.name: icnResourceFiles
element.definition: The element <icnResourceFiles> enables associated resource files to be referenced when the ICN content is presented or used.

element.name: icnSourceFiles
element.definition: This element <icnSourceFiles> enables additional source files associated with the ICN to be referenced, making it a complete unit.

element.name: icnSupportingFiles
element.definition: The element <icnSupportingFiles> enables source and/or resource files to be referenced and associated with the ICN when the ICN content is processed and/or presented.

element.name: icnSupportingFilesDescr
element.definition: The element <icnSupportingFilesDescr> contains a description of a collection of files associated to an ICN.

element.name: icnTitle
element.definition: The element <icnTitle> contains the title of the ICN object to which the ICN metadata file is related. This title is a generic title of the ICN object aimed to support management of the object. It is not necessarily relevant in any specific context where the ICN object is used, such as in the element <figure>.

element.name: icnVariation
element.definition: The element <icnVariation> contains the metadata for one specific format/notation of an ICN object.

element.name: identAndStatusSection
element.definition: The element <identAndStatusSection> contains the identification and status information of data module, publication module, comment, data management...

element.name: identExtension
element.definition: The element <identExtension> establishes a producer unique subdomain for instance identification. The data module identification extension gives the additional parameters needed to establish a unique identification of a data module in those cases when dat

element.name: identNumber
element.definition: The element <identNumber> contains the manufacturer's identification information.

element.name: identSleeve
element.definition:
The element <identSleeve> is contained in the list of identification sleeves element <identSleeveGroup>. The list of identification sleeves is a child element of the list of the standard parts element <standardPartGroup>.
It contains information concerning the properties of identification sleeves used in the Product's wiring.

element.name: identSleeveGroup
element.definition: the list of identification sleeves

element.name: if
element.definition: The element <if> contains an "if" statement.

element.name: illustratedPartsCatalog
element.definition: The element <illustratedPartsCatalog> contains the illustrated parts catalog information of a data module (excluding references).

element.name: illustrationRef
element.definition: The element <illustrationRef> contains references to other parts of the electrical system publications that contain wiring illustrations. Such an illustration can show circuit or wiring diagrams.

element.name: ilsNumber
element.definition: The element <ilsNumber> contains an interdisciplinary cross reference to an integrated logistic support number.

element.name: imfAddress
element.definition: The element <imfAddress> contains the information needed to identify the ICN metadata file.

element.name: imfAddressItems
element.definition: The element <imfAddressItems> contains information that is supplementary to the ICN metadata file identification, but not part of the unique identifier.

element.name: imfCode
element.definition: The element <imfCode> contains the core items of the ICN metadata file identification.

element.name: imfContent
element.definition:
The element <imfContent> contains the metadata supporting invocation and use of the ICN object in various contexts.
One and the same ICN object can exist in different formats/notations, usually because different presentation media raise different requirements. This can be reflected by use of several occurrences of the child element.

element.name: imfIdent
element.definition: The element <imfIdent> contains the unique identification of the ICN metadata file.

element.name: imfIdentAndStatusSection
element.definition: The element <imfIdentAndStatusSection> contains the identification elements of the ICN metadata file and its status information.

element.name: imfStatus
element.definition: The element <imfStatus> contains the status information pertinent to the ICN object. It is understood that these metadata are similarly valid for the ICN metadata file. This implies, for example, that if an ICN object is classified, then the metadata contained in a corresponding ICN metadata file must also be regarded classified.

element.name: impedance
element.definition: The element <impedance> contains the alternating current impedance of wire material, normally of a cable.

element.name: incorporation
element.definition: The element <incorporation> contains the incorporation status of technical conditions in the documentation.

element.name: incorporationStatus
element.definition: The element <incorporationStatus> is used to define the status of the incorporation of a technical condition.

element.name: indexFlag
element.definition:
The element <indexFlag> is used to contain the text of an item that is required to be included in an automatically generated index, usually arranged alphabetically, of the specific information in a data module or a publication. Such an index is usually an alphabetical listing of selected items/keywords and their location in a publication.
Example: The index of a book lists words or expressions and the pages of the book upon which they are to be found.

element.name: infoEntityRef
element.definition: The element <infoEntityRef> contains a reference to an illustration/multimedia included in the data management list.

element.name: infoName
element.definition:
The element <infoName> contains the information name describing the type of information related to the Product about which the data module has been written. It is recommended that the element is populated with the information code short definition (corresponding to the attribute infoCode in the element <dmCode>.
Projects can decide to modify (or extend) the information name to one that is more suitable, provided the sense of the information code is maintained. If there is a variation indicated by the information code variant (the attribute infoCodeVariant in the element <dmCode>, the information name can be extended to describe this variation.
Example
The short definition of IC 258 is “Other procedure to clean”. A project can have a data module that tells the reader how to clean with water. Another data module could tell the reader how to clean with air. In both cases, the information name can be extended from “Other procedure to clean” (normally IC 258A) to “Other procedure to clean, Clean with air” (can be IC 258B) and “Other procedure to clean, Clean with water” (can be IC 258C).

element.name: infoNameVariant
element.definition: The element <infoNameVariant> contains the information name extension describing the variation of the information related to the Product about which the data module has been written.

element.name: initialize
element.definition: The element <initialize> is used to set an initial value for the variable using the element <expression>.

element.name: initialProvisioningProject
element.definition: The element <initialProvisioningProject> contains the information regarding the initial provisioning project (IPP).

element.name: initialProvisioningProjectRef
element.definition: The element <initialProvisioningProjectRef> contains a reference to another IPP for non-chapterized IPD (in an electronic IPD publication it mainly addresses the first CSN of the referenced IPPN).

element.name: inlineSignificantData
element.definition: The element <inlineSignificantData> contains data with a significant meaning, such as a lubricant or manufacturer code.

element.name: insertObject
element.definition:
The element <insertObject> represents one data module fragment that has been added since a previous issue of the data module. When retrieving the new issue of the data module, this fragment must be inserted.
The attributes of the <insertObject> indicate the place where the new object must be inserted. It is recommended that these two attributes are used.
Only the objects that are allowed into the data module can be used in a data update file. For instance the data update file related to the part CIR data module must insert <partSpec> elements only.

element.name: insertObjectGroup
element.definition: The element <insertObjectGroup> contains all the data module fragments that have been added since a previous issue of the data module. When retrieving the new issue of the data module, these fragments must be inserted.

element.name: inspection
element.definition: The element <inspection> groups the inspection limit information with the associated remark information.

element.name: inspectionDefinition
element.definition: The element <inspectionDefinition> contains information about inspections. Inspections are a way to group tasks that are related to the topic or intent of the inspection. The element <inspectionDefinition> groups a set of tasks with the limit information associated, to perform the set of tasks.

element.name: inspectionType
element.definition: The element <inspectionType> contains the classification of maintenance into various types such as "systems", "structural" and "zonal".

element.name: installationInfo
element.definition: The element <installationInfo> contains electrical equipment installation information. The element is repeatable to cover multiple occurrence electrical equipment.

element.name: installationLocation
element.definition: The element <installationLocation> contains the installation location information of the equipment instances.

element.name: instructionIdent
element.definition: The element <instructionIdent> gives wire preparation or finishing information or electrical equipment assembly information in coded form.

element.name: integerValue
element.definition: Values within an expression represent a constant. The data type of the value is indicated by the name of the element.

element.name: interchangeability
element.definition: The element <interchangeability> contains the interchangeability of two or more items at the same location. The element <interchangeability> will only be populated if the element <reasonForSelection> does not contain "0".

element.name: internalRef
element.definition: The element <internalRef> is used to markup a cross-reference from one point in a data module to another point or an hotspot in the same data module. This is achieved by linking the attribute internalRefId to the target attribute id

element.name: internet
element.definition: The element <internet> contains internet addresses for the business.

element.name: isolateDetectedFault
element.definition: The element <isolateDetectedFault> contains the information needed to isolate the detected fault to an LRU from amongst a list of suspected LRU. This is done by referring out to another data module through the element <faultIsolationRef> or by describing a test on these LRU using the element <lruItem>.

element.name: isolatedFault
element.definition: The element <isolatedFault> is used to capture isolated faults information.

element.name: isolatedFaultAlts
element.definition: The element <isolatedFaultAlts> is an alternates group that provides the capability to group several alternate solutions of the isolated faults.

element.name: isolationInfo
element.definition: The element <isolationInfo> contains the diagnostic information for the observed fault. This is done by referring out using the element <faultIsolationRef> or by describing a diagnostic process using the element <diagnosticProcess> or simply testing the LRU using the element <lruItem>.

element.name: isolationMainProcedure
element.definition: The element <isolationMainProcedure> contains the individual isolation steps.

element.name: isolationProcedure
element.definition: The element <isolationProcedure> contains the isolation procedure including preliminary and close-up requirements.

element.name: isolationProcedureEnd
element.definition: The element <isolationProcedureEnd> contains further isolation actions (these are either within the data module or referenced out to another data module) or to the element <closeRqmts> containing a closeup procedure.

element.name: isolationProcedureEndAlts
element.definition: The element <isolationProcedureEndAlts> is an alternates group that provides the capability to group several alternate solutions of the isolation procedure end.

element.name: isolationStep
element.definition: The element <isolationStep> contains the textual description of the action, the question and answer alternatives. It can also include a title, warnings, cautions and notes.

element.name: isolationStepAlts
element.definition: The element <isolationStepAlts> is an alternates group that provides the capability to group several alternate solutions of the fault isolation step.

element.name: isolationStepAnswer
element.definition: The element <isolationStepAnswer> contains the answers to the corresponding question (element <isolationStepQuestion>). The answers are given in the form of a reference to another action, to one or more final actions (element <isolationProcedureEnd>) or to close-up requirements (element <closeRqmts>).

element.name: isolationStepQuestion
element.definition: The element <isolationStepQuestion> contains the question that is prompted by the action contained in the element <action>.

element.name: issueDate
element.definition: The element <issueDate> contains date information for the data module, data management list or publication module. Every issue initially written, completely revised or updated by changes, must be allocated an ISO 8601 calendar date in the form YYYY-MM-DD.

element.name: issueInfo
element.definition: The element <issueInfo> contains the issue number of the data module, data management list or publication module.

element.name: itemDescr
element.definition: The element <itemDescr> is used to contain the textual description of the parent element.

element.name: itemIdentData
element.definition: The element <itemIdentData> groups the properties that describe the part.

element.name: itemNumber
element.definition: The element <itemNumber> is assigned to the checklist item for reference purposes. It is used to identify the line item or the row number for data presented in tabular format.

element.name: itemSeqNumber
element.definition: The element <itemSeqNumber> contains the item sequence number. It also contains elements which store metadata about the item.

element.name: jobTitle
element.definition: The element <jobTitle> contains the job title of the individual contact.

element.name: language
element.definition: The element <language> is used to describe the language in which the data module is written.

element.name: lastName
element.definition: The element <lastName> contains the surname of the individual contact.

element.name: lcAbilities
element.definition: The element <lcAbilities> contains a description of the learners' current abilities related to tasks required of their job tasks.

element.name: lcAccessibility
element.definition: The element <lcAccessibility> contains the accessibility level for persons with disabilities.

element.name: lcActualPerformanceStatement
element.definition: The element <lcActualPerformanceStatement> contains a measurable statement of the actual or current performance outcome.

element.name: lcAge
element.definition: The element <lcAge> contains the information about the age of the analyzed performers.

element.name: lcAnswerOption
element.definition: The element <lcAnswerOption> contains a single answer option for true/false, single-select, completion, or multiple-select assessment interactions.

element.name: lcAnswerOptionContent
element.definition: The element <lcAnswerOptionContent> contains the content for an answer option to a question and can indicate that the answer option is correct or incorrect.

element.name: lcAnswerOptionGroup
element.definition: The element <lcAnswerOptionGroup> contains answer options for true/false, single-select, completion, or multiple-select assessment interactions.

element.name: lcAssessmentComponent
element.definition: The element <lcAssessmentComponent> contains the specifications of the learner evaluation requirement for a training component.

element.name: lcAssessmentStrategy
element.definition: The element <lcAssessmentStrategy> contains the requirements of the plan for assessing learners' achievements in relation to the objective.

element.name: lcAsset
element.definition: The element <lcAsset> contains images and other graphic assets to support an assessment interaction.

element.name: lcAttitude
element.definition: The element <lcAttitude> contains a description of the learners' current attitudes related to tasks required of their job tasks or their organizations desired performance outcomes.

element.name: lcAttitudeTowardContent
element.definition: The element <lcAttitudeTowardContent> contains the known attitudes of the target audience in relation to the required training.

element.name: lcAudience
element.definition: The element <lcAudience> contains the intended learner's profile taking the instruction.

element.name: lcBrowsers
element.definition: The element <lcBrowsers> gives the Internet browsers suitable for viewing the training material.

element.name: lcCapacity
element.definition: The element <lcCapacity> contains the information about deficiencies in the performers' capacity to perform a job that negatively impact the ability to be successful in completing the job, thus causing a potential or observed performance gap.

element.name: lcCauseAnalysis
element.definition: The element <lcCauseAnalysis> contains the cause analysis information. This is the third high-level container element in the element <learningPlan>. It describes technical data regarding the root causes of a potential or observed human performance gap.

element.name: lcClassroom
element.definition: The element <lcClassroom> contains the technical aspects of the course to take place in a classroom.

element.name: lcClient
element.definition: The element <lcClient> contains the name of the organization sponsoring or requesting the development of the learning plan. It can also include a short description of the organization.

element.name: lcCompletion
element.definition: The element <lcCompletion> contains the completion type interactions. The completion interaction asks the assessment taker to supply missing information to complete an assessment item. The completion type assessment item is also commonly known as the "fill-in-the-blank" question type.

element.name: lcContentIdentifierName
element.definition: The element <lcContentIdentifierName> contains the common name of the objective item. The content identifier can be any name an organization chooses to assign to a learning objective. Examples include "enabling objective" and "terminal objective".

element.name: lcCorrectResponse
element.definition: The (empty) element <lcCorrectResponse> contains a correct <lcOptionContent> response in a <lcAnswerOption>.

element.name: lcCourseIdentNumber
element.definition: The element <lcCourseIdentNumber> contains an alphanumeric alternate identifier to the project title.

element.name: lcCurrentEntryBehaviors
element.definition: The element <lcCurrentEntryBehaviors> contains the known existing knowledge, skills, or abilities of the target audience in relation to the required training.

element.name: lcData
element.definition: The element <lcData> contains the information about deficiencies in data that negatively impact the ability to perform a job, thus causing a potential or observed performance gap.

element.name: lcDeliveryDate
element.definition: The element <lcDeliveryDate> contains the date when the project delivery is intended to take place.

element.name: lcDesiredPerformanceStatement
element.definition: The element <lcDesiredPerformanceStatement> contains a measurable statement of the desired performance outcome.

element.name: lcDownloadTime
element.definition: The element <lcDownloadTime> contains a description of the maximum time allowed for download time in the client’s delivery environment.

element.name: lcDragAndDrop
element.definition: The element <lcDragAndDrop> contains the drag-and-drop assessment interactions. The drag-and-drop interaction asks the assessment taker to drag related items using the mouse and drop them on designated embedded targets. The response is evaluated according to the match table content model.

element.name: lcDuration
element.definition: The element <lcDuration> contains an estimated duration of the learning activity.

element.name: lcEducationLevel
element.definition: The element <lcEducationLevel> contains the information about the educational level of the analyzed performers.

element.name: lcEntryBehavior
element.definition: The element <lcEntryBehavior> contains the current skill level or activities of the learners in relation to the training purpose.

element.name: lcEnvironmentalFactor
element.definition: The element <lcEnvironmentalFactor> contains the information about causes of a potential or observed performance gap that is external to the human performer.

element.name: lcFeedbackItem
element.definition:
The element <lcFeedbackItem> contains the interaction performance information. Feedback information is displayed to assessment takers as the result of response attempts. Individual feedback items can be custom tailored to support complex, performance-based feedback scenarios for a range of user assessment interaction responses.
Linking of the feedback responses to the answer matching answer options is accomplished thru the element <internalRef>. As the markup example illustrates, feedback items can be linked to specific answer options to indicate correct and incorrect responses as well as to reflect feedback based on the number of the interaction attempts.

element.name: lcFeedbackItemGroup
element.definition:
The element <lcFeedbackItemGroup> contains the content for supplying dynamic feedback to user assessment item responses.
The element <lcFeedbackItemGroup> supports linking of performance-based feedback thru the use of internal referencing. Assessment designers can use the element <internalRef> as a child of the element <lcFeedBackItem> to establish relationships among answer options and associated feedback content. This allows for the development of robust and flexible assessment interactions capable of providing feedback to users in response to multiple interaction performance results. As the markup example demonstrates, feedback can be developed to support the answer status as it applies to individual question responses. Feedback content can be logically associated with the current number of allowable user response attempts as well as the correct or incorrect status of the response.

element.name: lcFileSizeLimitations
element.definition: The element <lcFileSizeLimitations> contains a description of the file size limitations in the client’s delivery environment.

element.name: lcFormativeEvaluation
element.definition: The element <lcFormativeEvaluation> contains the requirements of ongoing feedback on performance in order to provide evaluative information useful in improving the training.

element.name: lcGapAnalysis
element.definition: The element <lcGapAnalysis> contains the gap analysis information, which defines the delta between an organization's desired end state, as stated in its goal and objectives, and its current state.

element.name: lcGapItem
element.definition: The element <lcGapItem> contains the structure required to define the current versus actual performance metric and the delta between those points.

element.name: lcGapStatement
element.definition: The element <lcGapStatement> contains a statement of the gap observed between the actual and desired states of performance.

element.name: lcGoalStatement
element.definition: The element <lcGoalStatement> contains a description of what the client organization must ultimately achieve as the result of some initiative or acquisition.

element.name: lcGraphicStandards
element.definition: The element <lcGraphicStandards> contains a description of the standards and system requirements for displaying graphics, 3D animations from Computer Aided Drawing (CAD), navigation thru virtual spaces, etc.

element.name: lcHotspot
element.definition: The element <lcHotspot> contains a container for hotspot interaction markup. The hotspot interaction asks the assessment taker to click on a region of the screen to indicate a choice. The hotspot assessment interaction uses coordinate mapping structures to define and locate interactive regions located within the viewing computer screen.

element.name: lcHotspotMap
element.definition: The element <lcHotspotMap> designates an action area or interactive region over a media object, allowing assessment takers to click in that region. The user's clicked selection is scored as a correct or an incorrect response to an interaction question. The interactive, or "hot", region is defined within the <lcHotspotMap> as a series of "x" and "y" Cartesian coordinates assigned as values of objectCoordinate attributes of the <hotspot> element. Refer to Chap 3.9.5.2.1.8.

element.name: lcHumanResourceDevelopment
element.definition: The element <lcHumanResourceDevelopment> contains the technical data that describes a human resource type of intervention that will target the creation or modification of personnel selection processes.

element.name: lcImmediatePerformanceCompetence
element.definition: The element <lcImmediatePerformanceCompetence> contains the requirements for an evaluation instrument or plan that determines whether an intervention resulted in the desired immediate effect on human performance.

element.name: lcIncentives
element.definition: The element <lcIncentives> contains the information about the policies, programs, or culture of an organization or work group that influences worker motivation and prioritization of work tasks, which can positively or negatively impact the ability to perform a job or can be the cause of a potential or observed performance gap.

element.name: lcInstruction
element.definition: The element <lcInstruction> describes the specifics of a learning activity.

element.name: lcInteraction
element.definition: The element <lcInteraction> contains the assessment questions and a selection of possible answers.

element.name: lcInternalFactor
element.definition: The element <lcInternalFactor> contains the information about causes of a potential or observed performance gap that is directly attributable to the human performer.

element.name: lcInterventionDefinition
element.definition: The element <lcInterventionDefinition> contains the data that defines the requirements or specifications for performance improvement types of intervention or for a training intervention to be designed and developed.

element.name: lcInterventionImplementation
element.definition: The element <lcInterventionImplementation> contains the technical data regarding requirements for successful release and use of an intervention among the target population.

element.name: lcIntro
element.definition: The element <lcIntro> contains a detailed introduction and description of the assessment by use of the element <description>. It is used when the element <shortDescr> is not adequate to fully describe the content.

element.name: lcItem
element.definition: The element <lcItem> contains content for an item that corresponds to a <lcMatchingItem> response located within a <lcMatchTable> element.

element.name: lcJobCode
element.definition: The element <lcJobCode> contains the job code of interest for a performer analysis.

element.name: lcJobDesign
element.definition: The element <lcJobDesign> contains the technical data that describes new or altered job requirements, specifications, responsibilities, processes, etc, that will improve performance of the job by the responsible workers.

element.name: lcJobTitle
element.definition: The element <lcJobTitle> contains the job title of interest for a performer analysis.

element.name: lcJobTransfer
element.definition: The element <lcJobTransfer> contains the requirements for an evaluation instrument or plan that determines whether an intervention resulted in the desired effect on performance in the work environment.

element.name: lcJtaItem
element.definition: The element <lcJtaItem> contains the description of job task analysis as related to a particular learning objective.

element.name: lcKnowledge
element.definition: The element <lcKnowledge> describes the learners' / performers' current knowledge / deficiencies related to tasks required of their job tasks.

element.name: lcLearningObjectives
element.definition:
The element <lcLearningObjectives> contains the learning objectives data. Learning objectives state the actions, conditions, behaviors, and standards expected of the learner by the end of a training event.
Referencing content data from learning objectives: Learning objectives can be linked to the content items supporting them. Referencing is achieved thru the use of the element <dmRef> within an element <lcObjectiveItem>. Refer to Para .
References can be made for entire content data modules, or identifiable portions of content data modules, according to the rules of use of the element <dmRef> found in Chap 3.9.5.2.1.2.

element.name: lcLearningPlan
element.definition: The element <lcLearningPlan> contains the title of the learning plan and a brief summary of its purpose or content.

element.name: lcLearningPreferences
element.definition: The element <lcLearningPreferences> contains the information about the target audience's methods or modes of learning for the training topic in question.

element.name: lcLearningStrategy
element.definition: The element <lcLearningStrategy> contains the selected learning strategy for a training component.

element.name: lcLms
element.definition: The element <lcLms> contains the Learning Management System (LMS) name and version number.

element.name: lcLocalCultureConsiderations
element.definition: The element <lcLocalCultureConsiderations> contains any special local customs or cultural nuances to be considered in the implementation or delivery of a training component.

element.name: lcManagerialSupport
element.definition: The element <lcManagerialSupport> contains the description of factors related to managerial or supervisory support structures in the workers' environment that can influence the organization's ability to meet its vision, mission, goals, and objectives.

element.name: lcMasteryScoreCriteria
element.definition: The element <lcMasteryScoreCriteria> contains the score or grade that is the minimum expected in order for the assessment to be considered successfully completed.

element.name: lcMatching
element.definition: The element <lcMatching> contains the answer items and their corresponding matching responses in the form of a match table.
